description: Triangle of numbers T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + ((n+k-1)/k)*T(n-1,k), n >= 1, 1<=k<=n, with T(n,1) = n!, T(n,n) = 1; read from right to left.
comments: Another version of triangle in A090238 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Jun 14 2007
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 171, #34.
formula: G.f. for k-th diagonal: (Sum_{i >= 1} i!*t^i )^k = Sum_{n >= k} T(n, k)*t^n.T(n,k)=if k=1 then n! else if k=n then 1 else sum(m=0...n-k, (m+1)!T(n-m-1,k-1)); [From _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 18 2010]
example: When read from left to right the rows {T(n,k), 1<=k<=n} for n=1,2,3,... are 1; 2,1; 6,4,1; 24,16,6,1; ...
mathematica: nmax = 10; t[n_, k_] := Sum[(m+1)!*t[n-m-1, k-1], {m, 0, n-k}]; t[n_, 1] = n!; t[n_, n_] = 1; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k], {n, 1, nmax}, {k, n, 1, -1}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 14 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 28 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jan 31 2001
